posts.author: WizardlyWisdom
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Magic functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve Magic? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

When DMing, I like to use Magic as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Magic. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
Our table uses a house rule for Missile where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

The way I understand the rules for Missile, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

When DMing, I like to use Missile as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Missile that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
